data.name:
Eraser is an advanced security tool for Windows, which allows you to completely remove sensitive data from your hard drive by overwriting it several times with carefully selected patterns. Eraser is Free software and its source code is released under GNU General Public License.

Erasure Method Credits:
Gutmann (35 Pass): Copyright Peter Gutmann & Colin Plumb
Gutmann Lite (10 pass): Copyright Peter Gutmann & Colin Plumb
US DoD (7 pass): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US DoD (3 pass): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US Air Force 5020 (3 pass): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US Army AR380-19 (3 pass): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
RCMP TSSIT OPS-II (7 pass): Copyright Government of Canada,
 Royal Canadian Mounted Police
Schneier's Method (7 pass): Copyright Bruce Schneier
German VSITR (7 pass): Copyright Germany BSI Verschlusssachen
 -IT-Richtlinien
British HMG IS5 (3 pass): Copyright British Government
British HMG IS5 (1 pass): Copyright British Government
Russian GOST P50739-95 (2 pass): Copyright Government of the Soviet
 Union 
Pseudorandom data (1 pass): Public Domain
First/Last 16Kb: Copyright The Eraser Project

Eraser Copyright © The Eraser Project

Eraser Project Members:
• Sami Tolvanen: Mentor/Initiator
• Garrett Trant: Mentor/Researcher
• Joel Low: Lead Developer
• Kasra Nassiri: Developer/Security Researcher
• Dennis van Lith: Designer
data.value:
Eraser to zaawansowane narzędzie bezpieczeństwa dla Windows, które pozwala, kompletnie usunąć wrażliwe dane z dysku przez ich wielokrotne nadpisanie specjalnie dobranymi wzorami danych. Eraser jest darmowym oprogramowaniem i jego kod źródłowy jest wydany na podstawie Powszechnej Licencji GNU.

Erasure - wykorzystane metody:
Gutmann (35 przebiegów): Copyright Peter Gutmann & Colin Plumb
Gutmann Lite (10 przebiegów): Copyright Peter Gutmann & Colin Plumb
US DoD (7 przebiegów): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US DoD (3 przebiegi): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US Air Force 5020 (3 przebiegi): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
US Army AR380-19 (3 przebiegi): Copyright United States Department of
 Defense
RCMP TSSIT OPS-II (7 przebiegów): Copyright Government of Canada,
 Royal Canadian Mounted Police
Schneier's Method (7 przebiegów): Copyright Bruce Schneier
German VSITR (7 przebiegów): Copyright Germany BSI Verschlusssachen
 -IT-Richtlinien
British HMG IS5 (3 przebiegi): Copyright British Government
British HMG IS5 (1 przebieg): Copyright British Government
Russian GOST P50739-95 (2 przebiegi):Copyright Government of the Soviet
 Union 
Pseudorandom data (1 przebieg): Public Domain
Pierwsze/Ostatnie 16Kb: Copyright The Eraser Project

Eraser Copyright © The Eraser Project

Członkowie projektu Eraser:
• Sami Tolvanen: Mentor/Inicjator
• Garrett Trant: Mentor/Technolog
• Joel Low: Główny Producent
• Kasra Nassiri: Producent/Technolog bezpieczeństwa
• Dennis van Lith: Projektant

data.name: Eraser is free open-source software!
data.value: Eraser to bezpłatne oprogramowanie o otwartym kodzie!

data.name: Please help us to continue developing Eraser - donate some coffee!
data.value: Proszę wspomóż rozwój Erasera - zasponsoruj parę filiżanek kawy!

data.name: Could not open the required web page. The error returned was: {0}
data.value: Nie można było otworzyć wymaganej strony WWW. Wystąpił błąd: {0}

data.name: The task list could not be imported. The error returned was: {0}
data.value: Lista zadań nie może być zaimportowana. Wystąpił błąd: {0}

data.name: The Eraser documentation file could not be opened. Check that Adobe Reader installed and that your Eraser install is not corrupt.\n\nThe error returned was: {0}
data.value: Nie można otworzyć dokumentacji Erasera. Sprawdź czy Adobe Reader został zainstalowany i instalcja Erasera nie została uszkodzona.\n\nWystąpił błąd: {0}

data.name: Eraser cannot connect to the running instance for erasures.

Another instance of Eraser is already running but it is running with higher privileges than this instance of Eraser. Tasks cannot be added in this manner.\n\nClose the running instance of Eraser and start it again without administrator privileges, or run the command again as an administrator.

usage: Eraser <action> <arguments>
where action is
 help Show this help message.
 erase Erases items specified on the command line. This is
 equivalent to addtask, with the schedule set to now.
 addtask Adds a task to the current task list.
 importtasklist Imports an Eraser Task list to the current user's Task
 List.

global parameters:
 /quiet Do not create a Console window to display progress.

parameters for help:
 eraser help

 no parameters to set.

parameters for erase and addtask:
 eraser erase [/method=(<methodGUID>|<methodName>)] <target> [target [...]]
 eraser addtask [/method=(<methodGUID>|<methodName>)] [/schedule=(now|manually|restart)] <target> [target [...]]

 /method The Erasure method to use.
 methodGUID and methodName can be any GUID/Name from the following list:
{0}
 Only erasure methods labelled U can be used to erase unused disk space.

 /schedule The schedule the task will follow. The value must be one
 of:
 now The task will be queued for immediate execution.
 manually The task will be created but not queued for execution.
 restart The task will be queued for execution when the computer
 is next restarted.

 This parameter is only valid for use with addtask.

 target is one or more of:
{1}
parameters for importtasklist:
 eraser importtasklist <file>[...]

 file A list of one or more files to import.

All arguments are case sensitive.

Response files can be used for very long command lines (generally, anything
involving more than 32,000 characters.) Response files are used by prepending
@ to the path to the file, and passing it into the command line. The
contents of the response files' will be substituted at the same position into
the command line.
Ambiguous argument: {0} can be handled by more than one erasure target.
Tasks must contain at least one erasure target.
Ambiguous erasure method name: {0} identifies more than one erasure method.
The provided Erasure Method '{0}' does not exist.
Could not load task list. All task entries have been lost. The error returned was: {0}
data.value: Nie można było załadować listy zadań. Wszystkie wpisy zadań zostały utracone. Wystąpił błąd: {0}

data.name: Another instance of Eraser is already running but it is running with higher privileges than this instance of Eraser.\n\nEraser will now exit.
data.value: Już działa inne wystąpienie Erasera i jest z wyższymi uprawnieniami niż to wystąpienie.\n\nEraser się zamknie.

data.name: Another instance of Eraser is already running but cannot be connected to.\n\nThe error returned was: {0}
data.value: Już działa inne wystąpienie Erasera, ale nie można się z nim połączyć.\n\nWystąpił błąd: {0}

data.name: {0} has just been added to the list of tasks.
Are you sure you want to delete the selected tasks?
data.value: Czy na pewno chesz usunąć wybrane zadania?

data.name: The task {0} has completed with warnings.
The task {0} has completed with errors.
Could not import task list from {0}. The error returned was: {1}
data.value: Nie można było zaimportować listy zadań z {0}. Wystąpił błąd: {1}

data.name: You have dropped a set of files and folders into Eraser. What do you want to do with them?
Erase the selected items\nSchedules the selected items for immediate erasure.
Create a new Task\nA task will be created containing the selected items.
Are you sure you wish to erase the selected items?
Could not load the setting {0}\\{1}. The setting has been lost.

The following settings held invalid values:

{0}
These settings have now been set to naive defaults.

Please check that the new settings suit your required level of security.
data.value:
Następujące ustawinia mają niewłaściwe parametry:

{0}
Te ustawienia przestawiono na domyślnie.

Proszę sprawdź ten nowy zestaw ustawień poziomów bezpieczeństwa.

data.name: The path you selected is invalid.
Plugins which have just been approved will only be loaded the next time Eraser is started.
data.value: Tylko zaakceptowane wtyczki zostaną załądowane przy następnym uruchomieniu Erasera.

data.name: An invalid file erasure method was selected.
An invalid drive erasure method was selected.
An invalid randomness data source was selected.
Erasures with plausible deniability was selected, but no files were selected to be used as decoys.
data.value: Wybrano wymazywanie z opcją prawdopodobnego zaprzeczenia, ale nie wybrano żadnych plików na przynęte.

data.name: The new UI language will take only effect when Eraser is restarted.
data.value: Nowy język interfejsu zostanie załadowany po ponownym uruchomieniu Erasera.

data.name: The new randomness data source will only be used when the next task is run.\nCurrently running tasks will use the old source.
data.value: Nowe źródło danych losowych zostanie użyte przy następnym zadaniu.\nObecne zadanie korzysta ze starego źródła.

data.name: (This erasure type does not have any settings to define.)
The erasure method selected does not support erasing the erasure target.
The task has no data to erase.
data.value: Zadanie nie ma danych do wymazania.

data.name: The task needs to run on at least one day a week
data.value: Zadanie wymaga do działania przynajmniej jednego dnia tygodnia

data.name: There are no new updates or plugins available for Eraser.
data.value: Brak aktualizacji programu lub wtyczek Erasera.
